headline: Exclusive: Is Apple Late To Foldable iPhones? Ming-Chi Kuo Says Cupertino Isn't At 'Disadvantage' As Samsung Sees Foldables Go Mainstream
summary: Apple Inc.'s (NASDAQ:AAPL) long-anticipated entry into the foldable iPhone market may not be as delayed — or as risky — as it appears, according to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, even as Samsung Electronics Co. (OTC:SSNLF) says the category is nearing mainstream adoption. headline: Netflix Reportedly Prepares All-Cash Bid For Warner Bros. As Paramount Turns Up Heat On Takeover Battle
summary: Netflix Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) is reportedly preparing to revise the terms of its $82.7 billion deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery (NASDAQ:WBD) to make it an all-cash offer, as it seeks to fend off Paramount Skydance’s (NASDAQ:PSKY) hostile bid. The revised deal, aimed at offering WBD shareholders a quicker and simpler transaction, is still under negotiation and may change, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter. headline: Meta Triples Down on AI. It Could Be a Wild Ride for the Stock.
summary: Meta Platforms  CEO Mark Zuckerberg has never shied away from big moves, from dropping out of Harvard University to work on a fledgling social-media company to changing the name of that company even after it crossed $100 billion in annual sales.  This week, he may have signaled his largest move yet—a massive multiyear program, probably in excess of a trillion dollars, to build a global network of artificial-intelligence data centers.  A trillion dollars is a lot of money, even more than  Meta’s  Facebook and Instagram can provide, so the company also hired a banker as its new president and vice chairman.

content.title: Meta Triples Down on AI. It Could Be a Wild Ride for the Stock.
content.summary: Meta Platforms  CEO Mark Zuckerberg has never shied away from big moves, from dropping out of Harvard University to work on a fledgling social-media company to changing the name of that company even after it crossed $100 billion in annual sales.  This week, he may have signaled his largest move yet—a massive multiyear program, probably in excess of a trillion dollars, to build a global network of artificial-intelligence data centers.  A trillion dollars is a lot of money, even more than  Meta’s  Facebook and Instagram can provide, so the company also hired a banker as its new president and vice chairman.

summary: Oracle Corp (NYSE:ORCL) is trying to balance an ambitious expansion plan with investor skepticism as it builds out its AI future and reshapes its physical footprint. headline: ImmunityBio Advances First-Line BCG Naive NMIBC Program with Enrollment Exceeding Expectations and Positive Interim Analysis for ANKTIVA® Plus BCG
summary: CULVER CITY, Calif., January 16, 2026--ImmunityBio, Inc. (NASDAQ: IBRX) today announced an update on the status of enrollment in its randomized registrational trial in BCG-naïve non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC), QUILT-2.005. Enrollment has exceeded internal expectations and is now over 85% complete, with full enrollment of the planned study population anticipated by Q2 2026. headline: As Tech Giants Get More Hands-On With Energy, Their Risks Rise
summary: The race to build up more AI data centers has created a strain on the existing power grid while also bottlenecking the ambitious plans of the world’s largest tech companies.  AI systems consume far more energy than more typical servers and other computing gear, but new energy generation facilities don’t exactly go up overnight.  In a landmark deal, Google-parent  Alphabet  last month agreed to buy renewable energy developer Intersect Power for $4.75 billion, plus the assumption of debt.

content.title: As Tech Giants Get More Hands-On With Energy, Their Risks Rise
content.summary: The race to build up more AI data centers has created a strain on the existing power grid while also bottlenecking the ambitious plans of the world’s largest tech companies.  AI systems consume far more energy than more typical servers and other computing gear, but new energy generation facilities don’t exactly go up overnight.  In a landmark deal, Google-parent  Alphabet  last month agreed to buy renewable energy developer Intersect Power for $4.75 billion, plus the assumption of debt.

summary: Someone recently posed a question to multimillionaires: Is the phrase “the harder you work, the luckier you get” actually true, or is building wealth mostly a matter of gambling and being in the right place at the right time? headline: BDT & MSD Hires Centerview Banker Adam Beshara as a Top Executive
summary: BDT & MSD Partners is bringing on a Centerview veteran as one of its top executives, as the merchant bank grows its business advising and investing in founder- and family-owned companies.  Adam Beshara,  who has been a partner at Centerview Partners since 2012, will be one of five presidents at the firm when he starts the job in May, BDT & MSD executives said.  Run by  Byron Trott  and  Gregg Lemkau,  both former star bankers at  Goldman Sachs  BDT & MSD provides families and founders with advice and capital.

headline: Which social media stocks should your portfolio hit 'Like' on?
summary: Boot up your laptop and hit "Post" because Yahoo Finance is taking a look at how social media stocks are faring in 2026. Shares of Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta Platforms (META) are already down 5% year-to-date in the new year. Suncoast Equity managing director and co-portfolio manager Eric Lynch and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporters Brooke DiPalma and Ines Ferré discuss Meta's stock declines while also commenting on the market performance of Pinterest (PINS) and Reddit (RDDT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.
